name: Possessed Pillar
description: The Possessed Pillar stands large and imposing, resembling a robust column. It possesses a magnetic body and blends seamlessly into its environment when motionless, resembling a statue or carved column.
memorable: Its ability to restrain attackers with its magnetic body and its powerful magical attacks make it a unique guardian.
goals: To serve as a powerful guardian in its designated territory.
relations: Might be encountered alongside other constructs or magical entities.
environment: Typically found guarding specific locations or treasures.
strengths: High Strength for powerful melee attacks, magical resistance, and the ability to immobilize attackers.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to non-magical attacks from weapons other than adamantine, and can be overwhelmed by multiple attackers.
attacks: Can perform two Slam attacks that deal substantial bludgeoning damage along with damaging necrotic or radiant energy.
most_powerful_ability: The Magnetic Body ability can restrain attackers and immobilize their weapons, creating tactical advantages.
additional_information: Does not require air, food, drink, or rest.
Immunity to spells that alter its form.
Advantage on saving throws against spells.
Capable of dealing additional 2d8 necrotic or radiant damage with its attacks.
Indistinguishable from a statue while motionless.
test_queries: imposing guardian with magical melee attacks
magical guardian that appears as a column
